newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end higher on Wall Street, Ericsson.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end higher on Wall Street, Ericsson.

text.p: A surge in telecoms giant Ericsson and strong trends on Wall Street helped lift Swedish shares to a higher close on Wednesday.
The Stockholm general index rose 1.39 percent to 3,191.87 in turnover of 3.66 billion crowns.
"Low U.S. interest rates, a large inflow of capital to funds in Sweden and strong earnings reports keep lifting the Stockholm bourse," a trader said.
Ericsson staged a strong recovery after slipping five crowns on profit-taking a day earlier, surging 13 crowns to 367.
Forestry group SCA, which announced it bought Italian packaging group Cochis, jumped 8.5 crowns to 187.
"The acquisition had an impact, but forestry shares are going strong in general," a trader said.
Drugs group Pharmacia & Upjohn rose 5.5 crowns to 303.5 on relief that its six-month earnings report was not worse.
Engineer Atlas Copco jumped 10.5 crowns to 228.5 ahead of releasing six-month earnings on August 6.
The general index was at a record, edging past an earlier closing high set on July 16. -- Stockholm newsroom +46-8-700 1017
